headline: Ruben Amorim has already explained his reason for upsetting Man Utd star who 'didn't look happy'
body: Ruben Amorim has already offered an explanation after appearing to upset Joshua Zirkzee during Manchester United's 2-1 loss to Aston Villa. The Dutchman came off the bench in the defeat but perhaps expected to be introduced earlier than he was.

United found themselves trailing on the stroke of half-time during their trip to Villa Park after Morgan Rogers' sublime curling effort. Matheus Cunha levelled prior to the break, but Rogers added a second just before the hour mark and secured all three points for Unai Emery's side.

A casualty of the loss was captain Bruno Fernandes, who suffered what appeared to be a hamstring injury during the first half but continued playing. Zirkzee was a frontrunner to replace him at the interval but United icon Gary Neville was "surprised" to see Lisandro Martinez come on in his place.

Neville stated that Zirkzee looked upset at not being brought on at half-time, despite being introduced after 73 minutes, but Amorim provided an applicable explanation for a similar decision last season.
"I'm surprised as I thought Zirkzee would come on as he is closer to Fernandes' position," he said before adding: "He [Zirkzee] doesn't look like he's too happy."

But a not dissimilar situation occurred last campaign. Zirkzee started a tie against Newcastle in December 2024 but with United trailing 2-0 after 32 minutes, he was brought off the pitch and looked visibly distraught.

Amorim explained after the match: "You have to think about the team. The player is suffering during the game. We needed another midfielder. It was tough on me to do that. I talked with Joshua about that.

"I'm always thinking about the team. At that moment it was important for him to come out. I know that Josh is a really good guy. When he went to the tunnel, I can understand that some guys can be in a bad way but he is a really good lad."
He added: "It is life, and we will support Josh and continue. Newcastle were better than Manchester United. They weren't better than Josh."

Neville also had his say during this controversial substitution, much like he did when Zirkzee was not introduced against Villa. He said: "I know that he's earning a lot of money but there's a human being in there that's basically being cheered off by his home fans and that is brutal."
Despite Amorim making decisions surrounding Zirkzee for the good of the team, the Dutchman continues to be linked with a move away from the club.

Zirkzee was only signed in July 2024 from Bologna for £36.5million, but reports suggest he could make a swift return to Italy. Corriere dello Sport claim Roma are interested in Zirkee and the only thing currently preventing a transfer is a disparity on fees.

headline: Bruno Fernandes exchange with Aston Villa fans during Man Utd loss caught on camera
body: Bruno Fernandes was caught on camera hitting out at Aston Villa supporters from the dugout during Manchester United's defeat to the Premier League side. Fernandes was taking his place among the substitutes after picking up an injury during the game, which saw him replaced.
With his hood up and Villa fans laughing, Fernandes could be seen turning in their direction and attempting to put them down. "You sing more for me than for your team," he said.

"Don't be angry because I score always against you," he added with a smile. The Villans offered a sarcastic cheer as Fernandes was guided back into his seat by a member of United staff and faced the pitch.

The Red Devils captain's smile may not have lasted too long as Morgan Rogers' goals on either side of Mathues Cunha's effort ensured a 10th win in a row for Unai Emery's side. Fernandes was unable to add to his own impressive record against Villa, in the opening 45 minutes.
The 31-year-old has scored more goals against the Midlands club than any other opponent. United's talisman has bagged seven goals in 13 appearances and added three assists.
He was left with little to smile about in defeat and did not receive a reassuring prognosis. Fernandes could be ruled out for a month.

"It's a soft tissue, I think he's going to lose some games," said Amorim after the game against Villa. "I don't know for sure. Let's see. I don't know. I don't what to talk about matters you can't control.

"He is a guy who is always fit, so he might recover quite well. I think Kobbie Mainoo is out, Bruno is out. We will see. No excuses, we need to win the next game and we will try to win the next game."
Despite Fernandes' absence, Gary Neville believes United were the better team against Villa. The former club captain was reassured by the performance from Amorim's side.

“I thought it was a really good performance, but the details of the two goals have cost them," he said. “Now that’s going to continue to happen whilst they don’t have the likes of Harry Maguire and Matthijs De Ligt, and they don’t have players that would make them a lot stronger.

“I don’t think they are anywhere near good enough to get into that top three, but what I have seen in these last two games is a couple of things. One, the manager has changed, quite obviously, the system that he said he would never change – the five or the three at the back, the two in midfield, the two wing backs and the three up front – has been thrown out of the window in the last two matches. That’s a good thing.”

headline: How Man Utd can line up without Bruno Fernandes as Ruben Amorim makes transfer stance clear
body: It is a problem Manchester United have not really had to deal with, but one that Ruben Amorim is now faced with: what to do without Bruno Fernandes.

Fernandes is not only United’s captain and talisman, but also a near ever-present. Since signing from Sporting Lisbon in January 2020, the playmaker has barely missed a game. He sat out of two matches at the end of the 2023/24 season with a knee complaint and, later, another due to illness. Otherwise he has been there, in almost every starting line-up, making 308 appearances and contributing 103 goals and 93 assists.

Fernandes is inarguably United’s best and most consistent player. And he is arguably the most important player for any Premier League side, such is his complete and utter dominance of Amorim’s team. And now he’s unavailable.

For how long, we don’t yet know. Amorim said he will likely “lose some games” after being forced off at half-time against Aston Villa on Sunday. Diogo Dalot described his absence – for Boxing Day’s game against Newcastle at least – as “massive”, with Bryan Mbeumo, Amad Diallo and Noussair Mazraoui away at the Africa Cup of Nations and Harry Maguire and Matthijs de Ligt also injured.

Massive just about covers it. The January transfer window is just around the corner, but Amorim has already warned against panic-buying to find cover for their skipper. “I will see what we’re going to do,” Amorim said post-match. “I think Kobbie Mainoo is out and Bruno is out. So we will see. We are going to find solutions. No excuses. We need to win the next game and we will try to win the next game.

“What we cannot do is to reach January and try to do everything in urgency and make mistakes and then [it’s] ‘here we go again’ with a lot of mistakes. I’m not going to get [together] with [director of football] Jason [Wilcox] and [chief executive] Omar [Berrada] and say: ‘We need a lot of players.’ Because we have a plan. If we have to suffer, the club comes first.”

What is that plan? Well, Amorim is at least boosted by the return from suspension of Casemiro, who sat out of the 2-1 defeat by Aston Villa after picking up a fifth yellow card of the campaign. The experienced Brazilian will no doubt return as the more defensively-minded midfielder, but the identity of his partner is unclear.

Mainoo’s injury is extremely badly timed. The 20-year-old has been frustratedly sitting on the bench all season and the moment an opportunity comes, he is unavailable. Amorim has said he sees Mainoo as a more attack-minded midfielder and he might have been a good fit for the Newcastle game.

A look at United’s first-team squad on their own website shows just how thin on the ground they are right now. With Fernandes and Mainoo injured and Toby Collyer and Dan Gore away on loan, that leaves Casemiro, Manuel Ugarte and Mason Mount as the only fit first-team midfielders.

Choosing two of those three looks straightforward, with Mount the best replacement for Fernandes. The former Chelsea man has tended to play as one of the No.10s in Amorim’s 3-4-2-1 formation, but can drop back into the midfield two and has the creative instincts to push forward.

Ugarte, meanwhile, is completely lacking in such instincts and has been an underwhelming flop since making a £50million move from Paris Saint-Germain in August 2024. Shockingly, United have not won any of the last nine league games in which Ugarte has started.

Amorim turned to Lisandro Martinez to play the second half in midfield against Villa and the returning Argentina international did a reasonable job. But the defender clearly isn’t a like-for-like replacement and can’t play alongside Casemiro; instead he could return in defence, perhaps in place of Ayden Heaven.

The final option for Amorim comes from the academy – an area he has been accused of ignoring since arriving over a year ago. Indeed, Amorim referenced Sunday’s two debutants as options at Villa Park: “I think [Jack] Fletcher did his first game, so that is good news, [Shea] Lacey the same, so we will try to find solutions and go for the next game.”

Lacey is a wide forward who showed a glimpse of his talent by cutting inside off the right onto his left foot and getting a shot off against Villa. Fletcher – the son of ex-United midfielder Darren Fletcher – is a central midfielder who could earn more minutes in the coming games. But throwing him into the starting line-up against Newcastle’s Bruno Guimaraes, Sandro Tonali and Joelinton is a big step up and one Amorim is unlikely to take.

Moving Mount back into midfield alongside Casemiro seems the most sensible option for now, even if it leaves an issue further forward, with Mbeumo and Amad away. Lacey, 18, would appear to be competing with Joshua Zirkzee for a starting berth.

headline: Ruben Amorim signals huge Man Utd transfer warning after Bruno Fernandes injury
body: Ruben Amorim does not want to see Manchester United panic and make mistakes in the January transfer window following the injury to Bruno Fernandes. The Portuguese midfielder was forced off from the field during defeat to Aston Villa.

United's boss does not want the club to hastily adjust their plans with a knee-jerk reaction and revealed he would not be demanding new players from Jason Wilcox and Omar Berrada. The 40-year-old instead wants the club to stick to their long-term plan.

They have been linked with signing a new central midfielder after failing to persuade Brighton to part ways with Carlos Baleba in the summer. The club have since been linked with the likes of Adam Wharton and Elliot Anderson.

But Antoine Semenyo has been the most prominent name ahead of the January transfer window. The Bournemouth star has a £65million release clause and has the interest of Liverpool, Manchester City, Tottenham, and United.
Amorim is adamant that the Red Devils will not repeat the mistakes of the past by acting rashly. Even if that means suffering in the short term.

“What we cannot do is to reach January and try to do everything in urgency and make mistakes and then [it’s] ‘here we go again’ with a lot of mistakes," Amorim said. “I’m not going to get [together] with Jason and Omar and say: ‘We need a lot of players.’ Because we have a plan.
“If we have to suffer, the club comes first. Of course, we are in a moment where we need points but we need to find solutions and we are going to continue with our plan.
"You can feel in this moment that we are going to struggle, but we will see. We have to deal with it.”

Amorim's comments come days after suggesting United may have some financial backing for January. On that occasion, he emphasised any deal would benefit a prolonged period rather than cover for the club's AFCON losses.
"We'll see," Amorim said. "The only thing we know is that we only would try to bring players that we think are going to be the future.

"It's not going to be to save something in this moment, to cope with the losses of three players for AFCON. "It’s not going to be like that, even if we try to bring one player, maybe it's not the position that we need more.
"We will try to bring now – and in the end of the season – players that are perfect for our future. I don't know what is going to happen, but it's possible that we can do something."

headline: Man Utd learn Bruno Fernandes injury timeline after crushing blow for Ruben Amorim
body: Manchester United skipper Bruno Fernandes is set to be sidelined for at least a month after picking up an injury during his team's 2-1 loss to Aston Villa on Sunday afternoon. The Portuguese midfielder was visibly struggling throughout the opening 45 minutes, with a substitution forcing him off at half-time.

Now, according to The Telegraph, the club captain suffered a "suspected soft-tissue injury", forcing him to be withdrawn at the interval at Villa Park. Fernandes' injury couldn't have come at a worse moment for United, with key players Bryan Mbeumo, Amad, and Noussair Mazraoui all currently away representing their countries at the Africa Cup of Nations over the coming weeks.

This has already left Ruben Amorim working with a depleted squad, something that was apparent in his reliance on younger talent during Sunday's disappointing result, as he called on the likes of Shea Lacey and Jack Fletcher from the bench. Losing Fernandes represents a massive setback, particularly given his vital contribution to their recent improved performances, netting five times and providing seven assists from his deeper midfield position.

Discussing the injury following the match, Amorim said: "I think it's a soft-tissue injury so it's going to be a while. He is a guy who is always fit so we hope he can recover well. We will see. It's an injury and sometimes it's bad luck or something else at the same time. You can never control these things.

"We will need to find solutions and we cannot use anything as an excuse. We need to prepare all the guys that we have for the next game. No one is going to remember these problems, so let's cope with that. It will make us stronger."

Kobbie Mainoo might finally get his moment, following demands from supporters across all corners for the youngster to be handed his opportunity, as well as the public t-shirt stunt from his brother. The academy star is yet to start a Premier League match this campaign, despite having already demonstrated his capabilities at the top - featuring for England as well as scoring an FA Cup winner for United.

Mainoo was missing from the Villa Park defeat due to a minor knock sustained during training, preventing him from being the immediate replacement for Fernandes on Sunday, though he could feature in the Boxing Day encounter with Newcastle United. “I will see," Amorim responded when asked if the midfielder could feature in the coming week.
"I think Kobbie Mainoo is out, but we will see. We are going to find solutions. No excuses, we need to win the next game and we are going to try to win the next game.”

With another fitness concern emerging, Amorim faces some crucial fixtures over the coming weeks that may see the skipper sidelined. Given United's final realistic shot at silverware lies in the FA Cup, losing Fernandes for the upcoming Brighton fixture could prove devastating, alongside his potential absence for clashes against rivals including Leeds, Manchester City, and Arsenal.

Fernandes has been typically reliable for minutes since joining United in 2020, with this being a rare occasion where he will miss out. The club captain already has over 300 appearances to his name, with 103 goals and 93 assists, showing how huge his absence could be.

That said, it could be a peak into a post-Fernandes world for United and Amorim, just days on from an interview on his future. "I've always said that I want to remain in a place for as long as I'm wanted," he said.

"The moment I feel that I'm not 100% wanted, then I will talk to the club and say that I want to leave. I would like to try the Spanish league because I've never played in Spain. I would like to play for one of the clubs in Italy that competes for big aims like the league title, especially because I really enjoyed living in Italy."

headline: Spanish media in agreement after Marcus Rashford benched for crucial Barcelona clash
body: Spanish media have reached a verdict after Marcus Rashford was dropped to the bench for Barcelona's win over Villarreal on Sunday. The on-loan Manchester United forward was benched by Hansi Flick, having started a cup tie in midweek.

The reigning La Liga champions are putting up a valiant defence of their crown and faced Villarreal away from home in their latest league tie. Rivals and second-place Real Madrid had played on Saturday, beating Sevilla 2-0.

Rashford's side faced a difficult task when they travelled to Estadio de la Ceramica, and head coach Flick preferred to hand Raphinha a starting role instead of the Englishman. This decision paid dividends as the superstar Brazilian opened the scoring after 12 minutes before Lamine Yamal's clincher just after the hour mark.
Media outlets in Spain have now had their say regarding Rashford, who came off the bench in the 63rd minute in place of Fermin Lopez and enjoyed some space out wide.

Rashford had a few shots on goal in his time on the pitch, but his biggest moment came in the 89th minute. He was played in one-on-one with the goalkeeper but his chipped effort was cleared off the line by Sergi Cardona.

Marca were somewhat critical of the miss and wrote: "Barça combined very quickly in the attacking third. Rashford was one-on-one with [Luiz] Junior, he chipped it but it was weak and allowed Cardona to collect the ball in the six-yard box."

But their player ratings painted a different picture, describing him as "dangerous." They also said: "He came on in the 62nd minute. The Englishman always gives the impression of being very dangerous and only Cardona prevented him from scoring."
The decision to supplant United loanee Rashford with the now-fit Raphinha was hailed by outlet Sport, who give the 28-year-old a lot of credit but believe his counterpart adds something extra.

Sport wrote: "No one can complain about Rashford's performance during Raphinha's absence [midweek], but the truth is the Brazilian provides an extra dimension defensively and has an essential work rate."
They rated Rashford a 7/10 for his performance from the bench against Villarreal though and were in agreement that he was a dangerous player once introduced.

Sport added: "He's much more comfortable with space, exploiting it with long runs and powerful dribbles. He was generous in switching flanks and constantly offering solutions, always at the service of the team. His commitment and dedication were complete."

This outlet also saw eye-to-eye with others and had nothing but praise for Rashford and how he played. AS also singled out Rashford's speed and powerful dribbling as defining attributes. They wrote: "He used his power and speed to do a lot of damage from the left flank."

AS continued: "To begin with, the German manager substituted Fermín and Ferran [Torres] in the second half, bringing on [Robert] Lewandowski and Rashford. That's what happens when you have that kind of squad depth.

"But it wasn't either of those two players who decided the match. It was Lamine Yamal who pounced on a series of rebounds in the Villarreal penalty area to score the second goal that sealed the victory."
Rashford was hailed as a "potential game changer" by Mundo Deportivo who like most of the media in Spain only took positives from his appearance off the bench.
Using one word to sum up his match, they wrote: "Refreshing." They added: "His speed was his best asset. [Tajon] Buchanan had to grab him during a run, which earned him a yellow card.

"He had a clear chance to score, but his finishing wasn't quite there. He gave the team an attacking spark. We can't forget Raphinha's sensational performance too, as he brings speed, pressure and infectious intensity to Barça.

"And we can't forget Lamine, who tries everything and scored a goal that provided some breathing room in a crucial match for this league campaign, even though it's still only the first half of the season."

headline: Roy Keane singles out Man Utd star in wake of Aston Villa defeat - 'I'd be looking at him'
body: Roy Keane has questioned Diogo Dalot's effort in Manchester United's defeat to Aston Villa. The ex-Red Devils captain reckons the Portuguese star's performance should be looked at by Ruben Amorim and that Dalot needs to 'roll his sleeves up'.
A Morgan Rogers brace saw United fall to a 2-1 loss as Matheus Cunha got on the scoresheet. Amorim's side have now recorded just two wins in eight Premier League matches.

United's boss got additional bad news in the shape of an injury to talisman Bruno Fernandes, who is now set to miss games over the festive period. But Amorim first has to look at what transpired on the pitch, according to Keane.
The former Sunderland manager took issue with Dalot and several other players on Sunday afternoon. The Irishman was at a loss that they were unable to dig in when required.

"You can have all the talent in the world," Keane said. "We've mentioned it time and time again but you've got to roll your sleeves up and when the game gets a bit tight there's moments where you go, 'I'm just going to do my bit for the team'. There's too many players, like Dalot, that just don't do enough.
"I won't use the word cheating but they're not just doing enough. And after the game I'd be looking at him - I wouldn't be looking at other bits of the game.
"Same for the first goal when Rogers gets the ball wide. We're all sitting there and we know there's danger. Do they not know there's danger?"
With Bryan Mbeumo, Amad and Noussair Mazraoui away for AFCON, Dalot acknowledged players would have opportunities to step up. Youngsters Jack Fletcher and Shea Lacey both made their debuts.
"I think that's how the players who get opportunities need to look at it."

headline: Ayden Heaven bailed out 'not very good' Man Utd teammate during Aston Villa loss
body: Gary Neville believes Manuel Ugarte was rescued by teammate Ayden Heaven on two occasions during the early stages of Manchester United's Premier League match with Aston Villa. The Red Devils travelled to Villa Park on Sunday afternoon.

During the opening exchanges in the West Midlands, Morgan Rogers threatened to break the deadlock on several occasions, before ultimately doing so just before the interval with a strike from distance into the far corner.

Before the breakthrough, the hosts' most promising opportunities arose from careless possession in the midfield, particularly from Ugarte. He required assistance from his colleagues on multiple occasions, with Heaven producing an impressive early showing, alongside goalkeeper Senne Lammens.

"The problem with having Manuel Ugarte in a deep-lying position is that he's not very good on the ball, and there is an example of it. Ayden Heaven just gets that second block in that's absolutely crucial."

Thankfully for United, despite going a goal down, Matheus Cunha dragged Ruben Amorim's team back onto level pegging just moments after they had fallen behind. Matty Cash lost possession in a precarious area to Patrick Dorgu, and the ball eventually found its way to Cunha, who confidently slotted it into the far corner from close range.
They were not level for long, though. Rogers scored his and Villa's second just before the hour mark.
In the aftermath of that goal, Ugarte made way for Joshua Zirkzee. That was part of a double substitution that saw Jack Fletcher come on to make his debut, replacing Benjamin Sesko.

Ugarte's withdrawal also came soon after the midfielder received his first yellow card of the season. He was starting just his fourth match of the season, and first since the 3-1 loss to Brentford in late September.

United desperately needed three points to maintain their pursuit of Chelsea and Liverpool in the battle for top-four qualification. Victory would have drawn them level with their competitors on points after 17 matches.

Villa, however, had been in exceptional form recently and arrived on the back of a nine-match winning streak heading into the weekend's fixture. Their most recent loss came at Anfield against Liverpool towards the end of November.

However, they had subsequently defeated teams including Arsenal, Bournemouth, and West Ham United. It came as little surprise, then, that Unai Emery's outfit sought to establish an early tempo against Amorim's charges and exploit Ugarte.

headline: Gary Neville gobsmacked by Man United star's 'no excuse' moment in Aston Villa loss
body: Manchester United legend Gary Neville believes Matheus Cunha has 'no excuse' for missing his second-half header from close range against Aston Villa - a chance for his second equaliser of the game.

Cunha had already tied the score just before half-time, shortly after Morgan Rogers had given Villa the lead. However, United's inability to handle their hosts allowed the Englishman to restore the lead at 2-1 with just 32 minutes remaining.

Shortly after, United's No. 10 was given another opportunity to secure a second equaliser. With plenty of space in the six-yard box, Cunha misdirected a header into the ground and it bounced off target.
"[It] had to be a goal. It's an absolutely brilliant pass from [Mason] Mount and a wonderful cross from [Patrick] Dorgu. On a plate.
"He's got no excuse, Cunha, he has to score."
The Brazilian appeared devastated that he hadn't managed to capitalise on the opportunity, lying face down on the pitch until his teammates came to lift him up both physically and metaphorically.

Following his miss, United were still unable to mount a successful comeback in the remaining time and thus lost the chance to draw level on points with fourth-placed Chelsea following their stumble at Newcastle United over 24 hours earlier.
Roy Keane, commenting at full-time, added: "This is where football drives you mad.
"Absolutely brilliant delivery, as soon as it leaves his foot you're thinking [this is going to be a goal], and then there's no logic to it. We can't even explain it.
"We were saying here it is easier than a penalty. He's got five, six yards. Only the player maybe could explain it, whether he's lost concentration as it's coming onto his head?".
"Sometimes for a player it is too easy. On target and it's a goal. Another big moment for United."
United's troubles were added to with captain Bruno Fernandes in visible discomfort with his hamstring before the half-time break. The midfielder was eventually substituted for Lisandro Martinez.
Amorim has since stated he will wait on a full analysis of the problem, though is already certain he does not wish to dip into January's transfer market as a means to remedy any long-term issues.

headline: Ruben Amorim issues worrying Bruno Fernandes injury update to compound Man Utd woes
body: Bruno Fernandes is facing an injury lay-off after title-chasing Aston Villa made it 10 straight wins. Manchester United captain Fernandes went off at half-time which is a huge worry for Ruben Amorim as they suffered a rare defeat at Villa Park.
Incredibly, it was only Villa's second win in 27 Premier League home games against United as Morgan Rogers' spectacular double put Unai Emery's men back to within three points of leaders Arsenal.

But it was a bad day for United with Amorim now concerned that Fernandes - who has missed just 17 games in five years since arriving in 2020 - will be out while he also expects Kobbie Mainoo to miss the Boxing Day fixture with Newcastle United.

United boss Amorim, who said Mainoo missed the Villa game after suffering a calf injury, added: "It's a soft tissue, I think he's going to lose some games, I don't know for sure. Let's see. I don't know. I don't what to talk about matters you can't control.
"He is a guy who is always fit, so he might recover quite well. I think Kobbie Mainoo is out, Bruno is out. We will see. No excuses, we need to win the next game and we will try to win the next game.

The Red Devils, who are already without Noussair Mazraoui, Amad and Bryan Mbeumo because of AFCON, play Newcastle at home before hosting Wolves four days later. Their first game of 2026 is away to Leeds.
Amorim went on to address United's wider injury problems, having called on two academy graduates for their debuts in the second half. "It is really strange," the Red Devils boss explained.

"During this year, especially at this time, we have so many problems, but we have to cope with that. I think [Jack] Fletcher did his first game, so that is good news, [Shea] Lacey the same, so we will try to find solutions and go for the next game.

"I am a manager for six years and even Sporting [Lisbon] is all about the academy, so it's about the history. Every manager wants to bring players through from the academy and not spend money because this gives value to the manager.

"I just want to win and want to be certain that the players that come in from the academy are not going to suffer too much. I'm just trying to help the club, it doesn't matter if it's from the academy or abroad."

headline: opinionAston Villa show Man Utd what they're missing as Morgan Rogers sends England message
body: Unai Emery tore off his coat, swirled it above his head and then threw it away in sheer delight. Villa Park was alive, the noise was deafening as the home fans stood together to cheer another unforgettable moment from Morgan Rogers.
There have been a few this season but his first of two pieces of magic in one game underlines why Emery’s Aston Villa are in the thick of this title race. No wonder Emery was excited.

It is now 10 straight wins in all competitions for Villa and, even more incredibly, it was only their second win over United in 27 Premier League games at Villa Park. They are a team blitzing records.

It also showed why England boss Thomas Tuchel rates Rogers so highly and the Villa forward is making a very strong case to start the World Cup even ahead of his boyhood pal Jude Bellingham. Rogers was exceptional and, most importantly, he stepped up when Villa needed him most because they were not at their best and could count themselves rather fortunate to win.

Manchester United played well in large parts of the game but they lacked the game-changing, defining moments of brilliance which are supposed to be in the club’s DNA. Matheus Cunha drew them level with a brilliant, clinical finish but then missed an absolute sitter to get United a second equaliser.

Even more worryingly, Bruno Fernandes went off at half-time after stretching out his leg and if he is out for any time then you fear for a United team already missing Bryan Mbeumo and Amad who are away on AFCON duty. You might have thought it could be a chance for Kobbie Mainoo but he missed the trip to Villa Park because of a calf injury.

A cynic might be suspicious that his absence came just a few days after his brother wore a “Free Kobbie Mainoo” T-shirt in protest at his continued absence from the United starting line-up. But surely no manager would cut off their nose to spite their face.
Ruben Amorim also needs every bit of help he can get. Another blank for £74m striker Benjamin Sesko who has yet to get going at Old Trafford.

Amorim cut a frustrated figure as he threw on youngsters Shea Lacey and also Jack Fletcher - son of ex-United midfielder Darren who is still on the staff - for his senior debut. But even as Villa tired, United just could not find a way back.
Rogers reigned supreme again as he just looks unstoppable right now. For club and country.
Is Morgan Rogers currently the best player in the Premier League? Let us know your pick in the comments section.

His first goal lit up the whole game because after Villa’s fast start, it had faded away. Then Rogers struck. John McGinn sent over a long ball, Rogers’ heavy touch nearly let it run out of play but he showed all his pace and determination to keep it in.

Rogers then darted in from the left wing, cut inside and then curled a sensational shot into the top corner to give Villa the lead on 45 minutes. But, within three minutes and deep into first half injury time, United levelled.
Matty Cash found himself under pressure, Patrick Dorgu got a touch to Cunha who steadied himself and then made a smart finish into the far corner. Villa were ahead again after 57 minutes.

Youri Tielemans put the ball across, Ollie Watkins could not control it and then Rogers latched on and curled another brilliant shot into the far corner. Another Christmas cracker from Rogers. Sheer brilliance. Somehow Cunha headed wide from Dorgu’s cross to level again and Villa held on.

United will play worse and win. This was not a day for an Amorim crisis but it was a game which highlighted the reliance on Fernandes, a growing list of absences and also Sesko’s continual struggles. In contrast, after Villa’s worst start in 28 years which left them in utter disarray, they now have an incredible and wonderful momentum.

headline: Morgan Rogers downs toothless Man Utd as Aston Villa's streak continues - 5 talking points
body: Morgan Rogers was the star of the show as Aston Villa beat Manchester United 2-1 at Villa Park. The victory makes it 10 in a row for Unai Emery's side, who are keeping pace with Arsenal and Manchester City at the top.

A special strike from Rogers opened the scoring on the brink of half-time. But it was quickly cancelled out by Matheus Cunha in rather fortuitous circumstances after an early Christmas present from Matty Cash.

With Bruno Fernandes going off injured at the interval, United were weakened and Rogers took advantage by scoring his and Villa's second goal before the hour mark. Ruben Amorim's toothless attack were unable to draw level and saw their four-game unbeaten run come to an end.
Here are five talking points from Villa Park.

With Casemiro suspended, there was a good chance that Kobbie Mainoo would finally start his first Premier League game of the season. But when team news was confirmed, the 20-year-old was conspicuous by his absence.

As it turns out, Mainoo injured his calf during training on Saturday and it wasn't some form of punishment by Amorim. A storm erupted this week after Mainoo's half-brother wore a t-shirt to Monday's 4-4 draw with Bournemouth emblazoned with the text 'Free Kobbie Mainoo'.
Who else to open the scoring? Rogers has now scored six goals in his last six league games since the November international break.

His luscious effort to break the deadlock against the run of play was the pick of the bunch, too. Collecting the ball on the left flank, Rogers glided inside and took on Leny Yoro before unleashing a curling strike into Senne Lammens' top-right corner.
United's goalkeeper didn't even move. For Rogers' second, he beat Yoro again and produced a similar albeit less spectacular strike which Lammens had no chance of stopping.
It'll take something unwelcome or someone special for Rogers not to be starting for England at the World Cup. Cole Palmer and Jude Bellingham have their work cut out.
United probably owe Cash a Christmas card. In May, his weak backpass led to Emi Martinez's sending off in a moment that changed the course of the teams' last meeting, a 2-0 win for the Red Devils.
This time, the Poland international dawdled on the ball and was caught by the pressing of Patrick Dorgu. The ball fell kindly to Cunha, whose first-time finish ripped past Martinez.

United, who'd dominated parts of the first half, were level just three minutes after conceding. But there was a concern, with Bruno Fernandes clutching his hamstring on multiple occasions before the break.

It's not often you see Fernandes nursing an injury and even rarer to see him being substituted because of one. But a hamstring problem forced United's captain off at half-time and he was replaced by Lisandro Martinez, brought on to play in an unconventional midfield role.

The Red Devils had less of a goal threat with the enforced changed, perhaps a sign of things to come. With the always hectic festive period ahead, and with both Bryan Mbeumo and Amad at the Africa Cup of Nations, Fernandes' prolonged absence would be sorely felt.

A lot has been said about the Red Devils' academy in recent weeks, much of it by Amorim. But the United manager put his faith in youth by firstly subbing on Jack Fletcher, the son of ex-United star Darren.
There was another debut soon after, as the highly rated Shae Lacey entered proceedings in the closing stages. But there were no dream debuts, as Villa saw out the win.

headline: Man Utd handed Bruno Fernandes injury blow as hobbling star forced off
body: Bruno Fernandes has handed Manchester United an injury blow during his side's game at Aston Villa on Sunday, coming off with a hamstring complaint.

Ruben Amorim's side were in desperate need of a result heading into Sunday's clash at Villa Park, not least to keep the pace with top four rivals Liverpool and Chelsea. A win in the Midlands would take them level on 29 points, while a draw would leave them two points adrift.
It was a lively start to the game, with Villa close to scoring through Morgan Rogers on occasion. United also had chances through Matheus Cunha and Benjamin Sesko.

The deadlock was eventually broken on the brink of half-time as Rogers did get his goal, cutting inside and firing a rocket into the net from just inside the box. But Villa's lead was short-lived as United got back on level terms almost instantly as Matty Cash was dispossessed close to the United goal and Cunha found the far corner.

It can be argued the scoreline was the least of United's concerns, however, as captain Fernandes appeared to pull up late in the first-half. He was able to play on until the whistle, but was clearly in some discomfort as the players made their way to the dressing room.

Therefore, it was no surprise to see Amorim make a change at the break. There were limited options on the bench, with both Joshua Zirkzee and Lisandro Martinez the only two senior outfield players available.

It was Martinez who got the nod, with Fernandes then pictured with his coat on making his way back to the bench before kick-off. It was a bitter flow for the Red Devils as their captain has arguably been one of their most consistent performers this term.

Interestingly, pundit and former United defender Gary Neville was a little surprised by Amorim's decision to take a more defensive approach with his change. Speaking on commentary, he questioned why it was Martinez instead of Zirkzee who was called upon for the second 45 minutes.
"I am surprised because I thought Zirkzee would come on just because he is closer to Bruno's position," Neville argued. "I am quite surprised.

"Zirkzee doesn't look like he is too happy with it either, but you can see there now Martinez has gone in there alongside (Manuel) Ugarte in central midfield. He played there for Ajax a few times as well, United now have a back five and Ugarte and Martinez in front.
"It was a real shock to see Bruno pull up with his hamstring because he is ever present and hardly misses a game."

It took a little over ten minutes into the second half, but Villa were able to restore their lead to make it 2-1. Rogers, once again, found the net for the hosts with another curled effort into the far corner.

headline: Ozzy Osbourne's grandson is Aston Villa mascot for Man Utd clash in emotional moment
body: The grandson of Black Sabbath legend and Aston Villa fan Ozzy Osbourne was among the mascots as the club took on Manchester United in the Premier League on Sunday. Sidney, the son of Ozzy's daughter Kelly, was carried out by Villa captain John McGinn before the match.
Villa paid tribute to Ozzy back in August after the rock star died at the age of 76. He played his final gig at their Villa Park stadium back in July, just weeks before his death.

Following Osbourne's death, Villa paid a tribute of their own. "Aston Villa Football Club is saddened to learn that world-renowned rockstar and Villan, Ozzy Osbourne has passed away," a statement from the club read at the time.

"Growing up in Aston, not far from Villa Park, Ozzy always held a special connection to the club and the community he came from. The thoughts of everyone at Aston Villa are with his wife Sharon, his family, friends, and countless fans at this extremely difficult time. Rest in peace, Ozzy."
Ozzy's daughter Kelly got engaged to partner Sid Wilson before her father's final show. The couple were seen on the pitch with youngster Sidney ahead of kick-off in Sunday's match against United.
Ozzy's final Villa Park show saw him joined by original members of Black Sabbath for a concert dubbed 'back to the beginning'. At the time, he spoke about the significance of the event.

"It’s my final encore; it’s my chance to say thank you to my fans for always supporting me and being there for me. I couldn’t have done my final show anywhere else. I had to go back to the beginning," he said.

On the pitch, Villa hosted United knowing three points would keep their title charge alive. They had won their last two matches in dramatic fashion, scoring a last-gasp winner to beat Arsenal before coming from behind for a 3-2 victory at West Ham.

"Villa are definitely in the title race for me," former Villa and United striker Dion Dublin told Match of the Day. "I think in Unai Emery they have a manager who knows how to maintain performance levels and keep them firing."

"The elite teams always stay humble. I also think it is a mindset thing, we have to stay strong mentally, especially if you are on this run. We know it can stop at any time. The way we are going and the players that we have, I believe that we can go very far if we keep doing what we're doing and working hard."

headline: Nemanja Matic names which of his four Man Utd managers deserved more time at Old Trafford
body: Former Manchester United midfielder Nemanja Matic played under four different managers during his Old Trafford spell. Jose Mourinho brought him to Old Trafford, but it was the Portuguese's successor Ole Gunnar Solskjaer who Matic believes was dismissed too early.

Solskjaer replaced Mourinho in December 2019, initially on an interim basis before being appointed permanently. He was the second United boss of Matic's five years at Old Trafford, eventually losing his job in 2021

Michael Carrick and Ralf Rangnick spent time in interim charge after Solskjaer's dismissal, which came after a 4-1 loss at Watford left United seventh in the Premier League. Reflecting on the Norwegian's stint four years later, though, Matic argued United pulled the trigger too soon.
“We finished second and third under him. There was an atmosphere in the team that we weren’t happy finishing second, but when you see the results now, we did amazingly," Matic told FourFourTwo
“I think Ole deserved more time – and when I say Ole, I also want to mention his staff, like Michael Carrick and Kieran McKenna. They were going the right way to bring United back.

“Of course, they made the decision to sack Ole based on his final couple of results, but he was an amazing person with the right profile for the club. He and his assistants understood football – training was perfect and had every little detail ready for us."

Matic praised Solskjaer, in part for how he was able to keep players on board even when they weren't playing regularly. The Serbian started just four of United's 12 league games in his final season, but recognised the manager was someone who knew the club.

Matic would go on to leave Old Trafford in the summer of 2022, linking back up with Mourinho at Roma. He then spent time in France, playing for Rennes and Lyon, and is now back in Italy with Sassuolo.

Solskjaer took time out after leaving United, eventually ending his exile from management when he took over at Besiktas midway through the 2024/25 season. He was dismissed by the Turkish club in August, though, and spoke in November about a potential return to the dugout.

"I'm open, it's not like I'm desperate to be back but England, I love living here, I think so," he told Stick to Football. "My kids ask me mid-Championship and up, but I’m a football man. Is it Norway? Sweden? It’s about working with people. When I played Football Manager and Championship Manager, I like to defy the odds."

headline: Bruno Fernandes' Man Utd release clause bombshell emerges just before Aston Villa clash
body: Manchester United's skipper Bruno Fernandes reportedly has a release clause in his contract that is only applicable to clubs outside the Premier League. Since joining from Sporting in January 2020 for just under £50million, the Portuguese midfielder has become a key player for the Red Devils.

He was appointed captain by ex-manager Erik ten Hag in 2023 and has since racked up over 300 appearances for the club. Under the guidance of Ruben Amorim this season, Fernandes has netted five goals and provided seven assists in his 17 outings across all competitions.
His importance to the team is undeniable, but there was a chance he might not have been at Old Trafford this season if certain members of United's top brass had their way last summer.

Earlier this month, Fernandes dropped a bombshell, revealing that some were trying to push him out of the club during the previous transfer window after a hefty offer came in from Saudi Pro League side Al-Hilal.
Despite the prospect of a significant salary increase, Fernandes chose to stay at Old Trafford, with Amorim also keen to retain him, despite apparent opposition from higher up.
"The club wanted me to go, I have that in my head," he recently confessed to Canal 11. "I told the directors this, but I think they didn't have the courage to make that decision.

"I decided to stay, also because of family reasons, but because I genuinely like the club. The conversation with the manager also made me stay. But, from the club's side, I felt a bit like, 'if you leave, it's not so bad for us.' It hurts me a lot.
"More than hurting, it makes me sad because I'm a player they have nothing to criticise about. I'm always available, I always play, good or bad.
"I give my all. Then you see things around you, players who don't value the club as much and don't defend the club as much... that makes you sad."
Following the interview, which has once again cast doubt over Fernandes' future at Old Trafford, it has now come to light that the midfielder may have an exit clause written into his deal.

According to journalist Fabrizio Romano, the clause can only be activated by clubs outside England. "There is a release clause in the contract of Bruno Fernandes," Romano revealed in his latest YouTube video.
"And the clause is not valid for Premier League clubs. It's only for clubs abroad. It is slightly over €60million (£52.5m). So, nothing is imminent.
"Nothing is happening. For the summer transfer window, I would keep an eye on the interest from Saudi because I think from Saudi, they can return for Bruno Fernandes.
"Then it's going to be up to Bruno, up to Man Utd again. Let's see what's going to happen before or after the World Cup."
Meanwhile, United are gearing up for Sunday's Premier League clash against Aston Villa. A triumph in the Midlands will bring them on par with Liverpool and Chelsea, each holding 29 points.

headline: How Man Utd could line up if Ruben Amorim lands three dream January targets
body: Ruben Amorim has not ruled out January transfers for Manchester United and only wants players who can strengthen his team even after Amad, Bryan Mbeumo and Noussair Mazraoui return from AFCON. That is not always a simple task, but it could help the Portuguese coach kick on this season.

United could go into Christmas in fifth place with a victory over Aston Villa, and new signings could offer a timely boost for Amorim, having already strengthened his squad in the summer with Mbeumo, Matheus Cunha and Benjamin Sesko. Perhaps other areas now need attention.
"We'll see," Amorim said when asked if money was available for the transfer window. "The only thing we know is that we only would try to bring players that we think are going to be the future.

"It's not going to be to save something in this moment, to cope with the losses of three players for AFCON. "It’s not going to be like that, even if we try to bring one player, maybe it's not the position that we need more.
"We will try to bring now – and in the end of the season – players that are perfect for our future. I don't know what is going to happen, but it's possible that we can do something."
Antoine Semenyo may be top of the agenda, given the opportunity his £65million release clause provides. The Bournemouth star favours a move to Liverpool, but already met Amorim last summer.

The Portuguese coach is interested in fielding Semenyo as a wingback should he arrive and is said to be unconvinced by his current options. That could see an aggressive set of wingbacks in Amad and Semenyo, when the United boss returns to his favoured formation.

The duo would flank a back three of Leny Yoro , Mathhijs de Ligt and Lisandro Martinez, who would play in front of Senne Lammens. Luke Shaw would be a stiff contender for a spot, but Martinez's passing may give him an edge.
United's midfield could see further additions, with the centre of midfield a priority area for the club. The Guardian reports that Ruben Neves is an option as his contract in Saudi Arabia winds down.

Neves, 28, would cost in the region £20m but could bring significant wage demands after commanding £350,000-a-week. Conor Gallagher could prove to be an alternative option, while it is claimed United are interested in Bournemouth ace Tyler Adams.

Neves would be a strong candidate to start alongside Bruno Fernandes and to keep possession ticking. Tyler Adams may offer more robustness, but is out injured currently, and a second midfield addition may only open the possibility of Old Trafford exits.
A fron three was decided by United's significant summer business. Mbeumo and Cunha will provide plenty of support for Sesko if he can keep Mason Mount of the side.
Possible United lineup: Lammens; Yoro, De Ligt, Martinez; Amad, Neves, Fernandes, Semenyo; Mbeumo, Sesko, Cunha.

headline: Man Utd target Karim Adeyemi embroiled in fresh row after saying yes to Arsenal transfer
body: Germany star Karim Adeyemi will be hit with a fine by Borussia Dortmund following his reaction to being substituted against Borussia Monchengladbach on Friday. The 23-year-old has been linked with a Premier League switch, making it clear he favours Arsenal over Manchester United, but for now remains at Signal Iduna Park

Controversy has followed Adeyemi around of late. The forward, who is represented by Jorge Mendes, recently issued an apology after being fined €450,000 due to being in possession of two illegal weapons (a knuckeduster and a taser), claiming they arrived in a ‘mystery box’ he ordered online.

Adeyemi has six goals and three assists to his name this season, and has either started or come off the bench in every one of Dortmund's Bundesliga games. He lasted an hour against Gladbach on Friday but appeared none too happy about being withdrawn by manager Niko Kovac.

Sporting director Sebastian Kehl intervened when Adeyemi attempted to walk straight down the tunnel. Speaking to Sky Germany after the game (via Yahoo), Kehl explained the situation in more detail while confirming a fine was incoming.

“I told him: He’s not going to the locker room, he’s sitting there,“ Kehl said. ”The substitution was totally justified. Karim didn’t play well. He will be punished for it. I don’t want to see that reaction and neither does the coach or anyone else. It’s not right, and Karim knows that too.
“We’ve discussed this issue intensively with the team in recent weeks. If a player is unhappy, he can express it in the locker room or in the next day’s training session.“

Kovac, meanwhile, said the substitution was performance-based and might even have happened earlier. "I could have made the substitution at halftime, but I didn’t want to. I wanted to give him another chance,” the Croatian said.

Dortmund led early against Gladbach through Julian Brandt but had to wait until the final minute for Maximilian Beier to make the points safe. It means Kovac's side sit second heading into the winter break, albeit still some way adrift of league leaders Bayern Munich.
“I’m very happy that we won. At the end of the day, it was deserved," Kovac said. "We only allowed Gladbach one dangerous chance and missed one or two really good chances ourselves.

"We started well, but then didn’t do so well in the last 15 minutes of the first half. Gladbach came back a bit then. In the second half, it was an open game. We have to continue to work hard, stay focused, work together with the ball, but also against the ball. Then this team definitely have what it takes to finish in the top four.”

headline: Man Utd's painful Alejandro Garnacho statement after clear regret claim made
body: Manchester United may have seen Alejandro Garnacho as one of the club's future stars, but the player clearly had other ideas.

Chelsea snapped up Garnacho from United in August for £40 million following a breakdown in his relationship with Red Devils manager Ruben Amorim. Just over a year earlier, in December 2024, United had celebrated Garnacho after the 21-year-old winger was crowned FIFA Puskas Award winner, highlighting the club's deep appreciation for their player.

Despite the affection shown to Garnacho by the Red Devils, it seems the feeling wasn't entirely mutual, with Garnacho showing no remorse about departing the red half of Manchester. The Argentine claimed the award for his spectacular goal against Everton in November 2023, when he executed a remarkable overhead kick.

After the strike was recognised as the finest goal scored anywhere on the planet between August 2023 and August 2024, United made sure to praise their young talent. Their message suggested a lengthy future together lay ahead.

A United statement said: "Congratulations to Alejandro Garnacho, who is the winner of the FIFA Puskas Award for 2024. The Manchester United winger has been recognised for the stunning, acrobatic bicycle kick he netted at Everton in November 2023. Well done to our No. 17, and thanks to all those who supported him. It's a goal that we'll cherish for years to come."

Garnacho, even followed the footsteps of his idol Cristiano Ronaldo to become only the second United player to win the award after the Portuguese superstar, is now donning Chelsea blue. Ronaldo was the first recipient of the award back in 2009 for his long-range goal against FC Porto during the 2008/09 season while playing for United.
A year later, Garnacho has swapped Old Trafford for Stamford Bridge and he's not looking back. The winger candidly admitted that his departure from United wasn't a heart-wrenching affair.

He even suggested that leaving United was a necessary move for his career progression. When asked if he had any regrets, Garnacho simply responded, "No." Probed further about whether he felt any sadness over how his time at United concluded, he reiterated: "No."
He added: "Sometimes in life you need to change things to take a step forward or improve as a player," Garnacho explained. "It was the right moment, and the right club. So it was an easy decision."
Upon joining Chelsea, Garnacho didn't hold back in praising his new club during an interview with the official Chelsea media channel.
"I watched the Club World Cup and to join the world champions is special," he said. "We're the best team in the world! It's amazing to be here and I'm very happy."

During his time at United, Garnacho made 144 appearances, netting 26 goals and providing 22 assists. While he views his move to west London as the best decision for his career, his farewell message to United suggests he still holds some fondness for his former club.

Garnacho, who has netted four goals and provided two assists in 18 appearances for Chelsea, said: "After an unforgettable five years, this special chapter in my life now comes to a close. We have created moments that will stay with me forever, and I'm very grateful for this.

"To the coaches, staff, and my team-mates, thank you for believing in me. Every time I wore the badge, I gave everything I had. I leave proud of what we achieved together and excited for what's to come. Wishing the club nothing but success for the future, while I look forward to giving my all in the next chapter of my career."

headline: MARSHALL: Manchester United academy debutants have been warned what comes next by Ruben Amorim
body: Sunday, December 21, 2025, will forever be a special day for Jack Fletcher and Shea Lacey, regardless of Manchester United's defeat at Aston Villa. The 18-year-olds will never forget their professional debuts, especially coming for United on a big Premier League stage.

It's an interesting time for two academy graduates to be adding their names to a historic list of youngsters making the step up to the first team as well. Ruben Amorim threw them both on at Villa Park with resources stretched to breaking point, and he did so having been critical of the academy in recent weeks.

The relationship between Amorim and those nurturing the stars of the future could be strained after recent comments, with the head coach not always giving the impression he was happy with the quality or the attitude of those being developed.

However, in the West Midlands, he demonstrated that he was still willing to turn to them when needed. Fletcher came on with 17 minutes remaining and Lacey got the final six minutes, having been an unused substitute on four occasions recently. Both can be happy with their brief cameos.

There could be more opportunities to come. Casemiro will return on Boxing Day, but United will be without seven first-team players, with Noussair Mazraoui, Harry Maguire, Matthijs de Ligt, Amad, Kobbie Mainoo, Bruno Fernandes and Bryan Mbeumo all set to be out. That could hand more squad places to academy kids.

As good as Fletcher and Lacey might be feeling this morning, however, they have been warned that making their debuts is far from the end of the road and after Amorim's recent comments, they will know hard times could be ahead as well. Even for the best players, the path is very rarely smooth.

That is the point Amorim made a week ago when he cited the debuts handed out to Harry Amass and Chido Obi last season, who played for United at the ages of 18 and 17, but now find themselves going through different periods. Amass is playing well for a struggling Championship side and Chido is having a more difficult season at academy level.

Both players reacted badly to those comments, posting photos on Instagram of successful moments in recent months, only to then delete them. Amorim was unflinching in his criticism last week, but made the valid point that it can be dangerous to cosset young players and that sometimes they need to go through tougher spells as part of their development.

"Sometimes strong words is not bad words. Sometimes difficult moments is not a bad thing for the kids," he said. "We don’t need to be always with accolades in everything, in every situation. We are not helping."

Those are words that Fletcher and Lacey should remember. A month from now, the injured players are likely to return, and the Africa Cup of Nations trio of Mazraoui, Amad, and Mbeumo will be back. With a fully fit squad to pick from, Amorim won't be calling on Fletcher or Lacey.

They have had a taste of first-team football for one of the world's biggest clubs, but very soon they will be playing academy football again or having a loan spell in the EFL. When that happens, they should take Amorim's comments on board. They have enjoyed a memorable day in their young careers, but the hard work has barely even begun.

headline: MARSHALL: Manchester United stance on January transfer deal amid injury crisis
body: Manchester United are unlikely to sanction a January departure for Joshua Zirkzee until their injury crisis has eased or key players have returned from the Africa Cup of Nations. Roma are keen to sign the forward next month as Gian Piero Gasperini looks to strengthen his attacking options.

A deal isn't thought to be as advanced as reports in Italy have suggested over the previous 24 hours, but the Serie A giants are keen to sign Zirkzee during the window as they explore a loan or permanent deal. Even if a move was to accelerate, United are reluctant to lose an attacking option at a point when their resources are so stretched. Zirkzee came on for the final 17 minutes against Aston Villa on Sunday.

United lost Kobbie Mainoo to a calf injury in training on Saturday and then saw Bruno Fernandes limp off at half-time at Villa Park. Both players will miss the Boxing Day clash against Newcastle and while there is hope Mainoo could be fit for the clash with Wolves, Ruben Amorim expects Fernandes to miss a few games.

That is a blow when he is already without attacking options in Amad and Bryan Mbeumo, who are away with the Ivory Coast and Cameroon at the Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON). It means the only true attacking options available to Amorim are Zirkzee, Mason Mount, Matheus Cunha and Benjamin Sesko.

Amad and Mbeumo's absence will depend on how far their nations get in AFCON, but they are both among the favourites and the final weekend of the tournament is played on January 17 and 18. Amorim will give an update on Fernandes' fitness at his press conference on Christmas Eve to preview the clash with Newcastle.

United are working on an attacking signing in January as they eye up a move for Antoine Semenyo. The Bournemouth forward has a £65million release clause in his contract, but United face competition from Manchester City and Liverpool for the 25-year-old.

That clause is only active in the first couple of weeks of the window, so any deal could happen quickly. Should United land Semenyo, it could also free up the possibility of Zirkzee then joining Roma.

Zirkzee, 24, has struggled to make an impression at Old Trafford since his £36.5million move from Bologna in July 2024. He has managed just eight goals and three assists in 60 games for the club and has started just 17 Premier League games.

headline: RAILSTON: Ruben Amorim defends three Manchester United players after Aston Villa defeat
body: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim defended Leny Yoro, Ayden Heaven and Benjamin Sesko after the team's 2-1 defeat to Aston Villa. United left Birmingham empty-handed on Sunday following two goals from Morgan Rogers.

Yoro gave Rogers yards of space for the opening goal of the game, and he was at the scene of the crime again when the in-form England international fired his side back into the lead. Heaven was tested against the experienced Ollie Watkins, while Sesko missed two chances in quick succession in the first half on his first start since recovering from a knee injury.

Discussing Sesko in his post-match press conference, Amorim said: "He is returning to competition, really fast, he is going to improve a lot, the idea was 70-75 [minutes], he stopped for a while, we are trying to help the players."

When discussing whether United conceded similar goals at Villa Park, Amorim defended Yoro and Heaven, saying: "Sometimes we can suffer goals and concede. When you want to press and they kick the ball, Rogers can go both sides, it is really hard to defend a player like that one against one.

"We had some games against Nottingham Forest, Ayden [Heaven] and Leny [Yoro] defend one against one most of the time, Luke Shaw is the same. It is not just if you suffer goals, but the way. Sometimes the details can change the narrative."
United had the opportunity to move up to fifth in the table with a victory against Villa, but they will head into the Boxing Day game against Newcastle sitting in seventh position in the league.
Amorim will be without Bruno Fernandes, who picked up a muscle injury in the first half of the game. "I think it's soft tissue so it's going to be a while. We'll see," the United boss said.
When asked whether Kobbie Mainoo could return to face Newcastle, he added: "Kobbie Mainoo is out, Bruno is out, so we'll see. No excuses, we'll try to win the next game."

headline: Man United transfer news LIVE - Antoine Semenyo twist, Bruno Fernandes bid, Carlos Baleba plan
body: The January transfer window is fast approaching and Manchester United could be one of the busiest Premier League clubs over the next month.

Ruben Amorim's side are expected to dip into the market to strengthen their squad, with Antoine Semenyo at the top of their wanted list after impressing for Bournemouth. Tottenham, Manchester City and Liverpool are among the others that are interested in the Ghanaian.

Elsewhere, United are searching for at least one, if not, two central midfielders. The Reds tried to sign Carlos Baleba in the summer but he ended up remaining at Brighton. While Amorim's men could return for Baleba, they have also set their sets on both Elliot Anderson and Adam Wharton.

As for outgoings, there are a number of players that could leave Old Trafford. Kobbie Mainoo is one, with the 20-year-old midfielder said to be keen on a permanent United exit. Joshua Zirkzee is another, as Roma and AC Milan continue to track his situation following a difficult start to life at the Reds.
Stay tuned with the latest United transfer news and rumours throughout the morning here....
Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes is facing at least one month out of action after suffering from an injury in his side's 2-1 defeat at Aston Villa on Sunday afternoon.
That's according to The Telegraph, who report that the club captain sustained a "suspected soft-tissue injury", which saw him forced off at half-time at Villa Park.
Italian newspaper Il Messaggero have reported that Man United would only let Joshua Zirkzee depart the club in mid to late January, when Bryan Mbeumo and Amad will be back from AFCON.

AS Roma are keen to sign the forward, though they are also considering Atletico Madrid's Giacomo Raspadori. The Serie A side have put forward an inital loan fee worth €5m and an option to buy of €30m, although United are said to be keen on €50m.
According to the Telegraph, Liverpool are prepared to stop pursuing Antoine Semenyo, which would put the winger in a more favourable position to sign for Manchester United.
United want to bring Semenyo to Old Trafford in January but face competition from a number of Premier League rivals, with Manchester City, Tottenham and Liverpool said last week to among them.
But if Liverpool now drop out of the race for the Ghana international, it would give United a major boost to get a deal over the deal.
If Antoine Semenyo were to sign for Manchester United, transfer expert Fabrizio Romano has suggested his arrival would be directly linked to Joshua Zirkzee's exit.

The Dutchman has been left frustrated with his lack of game time this season and in a World Cup year, he is open leaving United in January. A return to Serie A is being discussed and progress on a potential move to Roma is moving fast.

Manchester United have made a 'significant effort' to sign Antoine Semenyo from Bournemouth and have presented what is described as an impressive package that includes substantial terms and a key role under Ruben Amorim, according to reports.
United are 'serious' about signing Semenyo and the club has explained its vision to the player about how he would sit into their system.
According to transfer journalist Matteo Moretto, Roma want to add Joshua Zirkzee to their squad in the first week of January, and it's claimed they are 'nearing an agreement with Manchester United'.
While it was previously revealed that United do not want to lose Zirkzee before January 18 due to the Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON), this date has now moved forward three days.
Zirkzee is thought to have 'expressed his appreciation' for a move to Rome, with the Serie A club aiming to complete a loan transfer with an option to buy.

headline: RAILSTON: I spotted Matheus Cunha's emotional reaction to Manchester United teammate vs Aston Villa
body: Manchester United lost 2-1 to Aston Villa in the Premier League on Sunday. Villa took the lead through Morgan Rogers just before half-time, but Matheus Cunha produced a practically immediate response.
The score was level at the break and Bruno Fernandes was brought off after picking up an injury. Lisandro Martinez was selected to replace Fernandes and he stepped into a midfield role.
Rogers restored Villa's lead in the 58th minute to claim the three points for his side.
Here are the moments you might have missed:
Cunha hands on his head

Benjamin Sesko was sent through on goal twice in quick succession in the first half and he failed to finish on both occasions. Sesko could have struck the ball quicker - that has been a recurring theme since his arrival from Germany - for the first chance, and he tried to round Emiliano Martinez for the second opportunity.
It was the wrong decision from Sesko. He could have lifted the ball above Martinez if he'd decided to hit it first time, but he tried to take it beyond the goalkeeper and his touch was heavy.
Cunha was responsible for playing Sesko through and he reacted by putting his head in his hands. The Brazilian's reaction said it all - he knew Sesko had wasted a massive chance to go ahead.
Sesko seems to want an extra second on the ball in the box. He got that time in the Bundesliga, but the Premier League is a different beast. He must sharpen up on his decision-making.
Amorim unhappy with Yoro

Amorim dished out constant instructions to Leny Yoro during the Bournemouth game, and footage of one of their interactions went viral on social media. Amorim was speaking about Yoro in his mother tongue, but you did not need to speak Portuguese to work out that he was not happy with the defender.
Yoro was on the receiving end of further instructions against Villa. "Leny!" Amorim shouted in the 14th minute, seemingly wanting him to provide width when Ayden Heaven was on the ball in the centre.

Moments before, Yoro had been all over the shop when Ollie Watkins had been played through. The 20-year-old has not been at his best this season, but it's important to note that he looked settled on the left side of the back-three in the spring, and he may be getting to grips with playing on the right.

The warning signs were there, and Yoro was at fault for Villa's opening goal. He gave one of the most in-form players in the league, Rogers, yards of space around the box and was punished for that mistake. Then Yoro was at the scene of the crime again when Rogers scored his second of the game.
The wild Emery celebration
Unai Emery reacted to Rogers' second goal by throwing his coat into the air. Amorim angrily looked at the floor, and a steward picked up the Spaniard's coat before handing it back to him.
Emery's celebration helped to whip up the crowd around the dug-out. Villa Park found its voice again - the home crowd had become frustrated earlier in the game - and roared their side on.

The United section could still be heard, though, chanting "you've only come to see United" and "if Fletcher scores, we're on the pitch" following the introduction of Jack Fletcher with 20 minutes remaining.
United have won three times on the road in the league this term and the travelling fans deserve better.
Mount tried to set the tempo
Mount has described himself as the "catalyst" for the team's press and his energy was important on Sunday, particularly in the opening exchanges when Villa made an aggressive start to the contest.

The hosts fashioned a few opportunities, and Rogers came within inches of scoring. United needed to match the tempo of the opposition, so Mount made a crunching challenge on Ian Maatsen. Mount did brilliantly to get across to Maatsen, and the execution of the tackle was perfect.

The midfielder received a huge cheer from the away section. Mount was subsequently spotted giving instructions to Sesko, and he was seen pleading to the referee over something when United conceded before half time.
United need more players with the same desire as Mount.
Heaton's message for Lacey
Amorim has copped some flak for his handling of academy players, but he introduced Fletcher and handed a senior debut to Shea Lacey with just over six minutes remaining at Villa Park.
Tom Heaton passed on some words of encouragement for Lacey as he got ready to make his debut, tapping him on the chest as if to say "go out and there and show what you can do".

Lacey received a warm reception from United fans when he stepped onto the pitch, and he could get more opportunities over the next few weeks due to United missing players at the Africa Cup of Nations.

headline: MARSHALL: Ruben Amorim gives Bruno Fernandes injury update and makes Manchester United transfer statement
body: Ruben Amorim insists Manchester United won't rip up their January transfer plans despite losing captain Bruno Fernandes to a muscle injury against Aston Villa. Fernandes joined fellow midfielder Kobbie Mainoo on the injury list after he withdrew on the eve of the game.

Fernandes clutched his hamstring late in the first half at Villa Park and was forced off at the break, with Amorim confirming it was a soft tissue problem. Mainoo injured his calf in training on Saturday and couldn't be part of the squad.

Both midfielders are expected to miss the Boxing Day clash with Newcastle when United will find resources stretched to their limit. Casemiro will return to the side after serving a suspension against Aston Villa, but the out-of-form Manuel Ugarte is the only other fit senior central midfielder.

Amorim will look for solutions against the Magpies, but insisted he won't use the injuries as an excuse. Lisandro Martinez came on in midfield against Aston Villa and Jack Fletcher made his first-team debut from the bench.
“It’s a soft tissue, I think he’s going to lose some games, I don’t know for sure. Let’s see," Amorim said of Fernandes.
“I don’t know. I don’t want to talk about matters you can’t control. He is a guy who is always fit so he might recover quite well.
"I think Kobbie might be out [against Newcastle], Bruno is out, so we will see, we are going to find solutions, no excuses, we need to win the next game and we will try to win the next game."

United are reluctant to make a move for a short-term target in January, and Amorim has confirmed that he wants to stick to the long-term plan and wouldn't be asking director of football Jason Wilcox and chief executive Omar Berrada for a sticking plaster solution.
They are set to make a move for Antoine Semenyo when the window opens, with the attacker set to leave Bournemouth next month, but a move for a midfielder might have to wait until the summer.

"What we cannot do is to reach January and try to do everything in urgency and make mistakes," said Amorim. "And then here we go again with a lot of mistakes. I'm not going to get with Jason under Omar and I'm going to say we need a lot of players because we have a plan.

"If we have to suffer, the club comes first. Of course, we are in the moment that we need points, but we need to find solutions and we are going to continue with our plan. Of course, you can feel that in this moment we are going to struggle, but we'll see."

headline: MARSHALL: Manchester United player ratings vs Aston Villa as Matheus Cunha good but two 4/10s
body: United had edged the first half but some casual defending from Leny Yoro allowed Morgan Rogers to cut inside and bend a stunning finish past Senne Lammens. The visitors were level a few minutes later. Patrick Dorgu nicked the ball off Matty Cash and Matheus Cunha found another excellent finish.
The game was delivering spectacular moments and Villa found another when Rogers again whipped a brilliant finish into the top corner.

headline: Roy Keane names Manchester United player who 'defied logic' vs Aston Villa
body: Pundit Roy Keane believes Manchester United attacker Matheus Cunha "defied logic" during their narrow 2-1 defeat away at Aston Villa on Sunday.

Ruben Amorim's side were in desperate need of three points at Villa Park in order to keep pace with their top-four rivals. The defeat means they remain seventh in the standings, a point behind Sunderland and three adrift of both Liverpool and Chelsea.

Despite a promising start against Unai Emery's side, a moment of magic from Morgan Rogers on the brink of half-time broke the deadlock. United, though, reacted quickly and got themselves back on level terms just minutes later courtesy of an effort from Cunha.

Rogers was the man of the moment again in the second half, producing another impressive finish just before the hour mark. Amorim’s men were ultimately unable to claw their way back once more, despite creating a handful of clear-cut chances.

While the overall performance was somewhat disappointing given the result, Keane was impressed with Cunha’s work going forward. The Brazilian may have missed a glaring opportunity to level things up in the second half, but the ex-United defender has no doubts about his overall quality.
"And then he misses a sitter in the second half, which defies logic really, it's hard to see how he missed that."
Sunday's loss was the sixth time in eight games United have dropped points. Since the beginning of November, the Red Devils have drawn four, lost two and won two in the Premier League.

While they may have deserved more than defeat at Villa Park, Keane refused to buy into the idea that they were simply unlucky. Ultimately, they are giving too much away to their opposition, something that was highlighted a week prior to the Villa game in a chaotic, end-to-end 4-4 draw at home to Bournemouth.
Discussing United's performance more generally, Keane added: "I wouldn't say they were unlucky - they gave up two goals. They've conceded six goals in the last two games, and that's not good enough.

"We praise them going forward, and they are more of a goal threat, but with the amount of chances and goals they're giving up, you can't make progress. United can dig deep, they showed that again today, but they need to be more intense when they’re defending, they need more pride there.
"You can't give up six goals in two matches and expect to get results because you're making it too hard for yourselves. Out of possession, they are nowhere near good enough."
